alert.note: Alert for Escambia Coastal; Santa Rosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 2:18PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Santa Rosa and southeastern Escambia Counties through 200 PM CDT... At 117 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northeast of Oriole Beach, or 9 miles northeast of Gulf Breeze, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds between 30 and 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ferry Pass, Gulf Breeze, Oriole Beach, Navarre, Navarre Beach and Pensacola Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
